digest_items.title: Implement network segmentation
digest_items.why: Segmentation limits lateral movement in case of breach
digest_items.fix: Separate production, staging, and development networks with firewalls

digest_items.title: Verify patch management process
digest_items.why: Unpatched systems are vulnerable to known exploits
digest_items.fix: Establish regular patching schedule and test updates before deployment

digest_items.title: Enable DNSSEC for your domain
digest_items.why: DNSSEC prevents DNS spoofing attacks by cryptographically signing DNS records
digest_items.fix: Contact your DNS provider to enable DNSSEC and add DS records to your registrar

digest_items.title: Use security linters in CI/CD
digest_items.why: Automated security checks catch vulnerabilities before deployment
digest_items.fix: Integrate tools like Bandit (Python), ESLint security plugin (JS)

digest_items.title: Verify SSL certificate validity
digest_items.why: Expired certificates break HTTPS and expose users to MITM attacks
digest_items.fix: Set up automated renewal with Let's Encrypt or monitor expiry dates

digest_items.title: Verify SPF records are configured
digest_items.why: SPF records prevent email spoofing by specifying which servers can send email for your domain
digest_items.fix: Add a TXT record: 'v=spf1 include:_spf.google.com ~all' (adjust for your mail provider)

digest_items.title: Use principle of least privilege
digest_items.why: Excessive permissions increase blast radius of compromised accounts
digest_items.fix: Grant only minimum necessary permissions for each role
